Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2008 07:09PM hbernier wrote: I had a total knee replacement in Dec. 05, diagnosed with breast cancer in 5/08, and finished chemo (AC and Taxol) in September of 08.  I have not had any problems with my prothesis, nor did any of my doctors express any concern with this issue.  I have not experienced any increased discomfort in my replacement knee since treatment.  I would be interested in what you have heard about this, as I do not and did not have much faith in my oncologists during treatment. ( I have since changed docs.).  Good luck.
Posts.Title: Chemo and joint replacements CCBoise hbernier

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2008 06:32PM hbernier wrote: I also never covered my head while going thru treatment.  I had bought some caps, wore them one week, and felt like I was hiding the real me.  I am a nurse and kept working thru chemo and radiation.  I have since heard from co-workers that they were inspired, their word, not mine, by my baldness.  I loved being without hair, tho I am now growing it back.  I will most likely keep it short from now on.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Embracing the Bald BooBee Meadow
